Service Details: - Supports mothers in crisis and provides ongoing support to low income mothers allowing them to overcome the negative impact of poverty and marginalization- Works as a safety net for single, low income and mothers who are currently employed or are seeking employment but are ineligible for benefits or community service support- Programs include comprehensive and individual donation programs, supplemental food support program including fresh food hampers through the sustainable nourishment program, emergency holiday hamper program, and the Mamas mental wellness program which includes resource referrals- Works to ensure no mama or child is left behind because of a lack of resources- Collaborates with many support agencies to ensure our mamas' needs are met
Hours: Our hours of operation:Mon: by appointment onlyTue: 10:00am - 4:00pmWed: 10:00am - 4:00pmThu: 10:00am - 4:00pmFri: by appointment onlySat: closedSun: 2:00pm - 5:00pm
How to Apply: Please email info@mamasformamas.ca for an intake appointment
Cost: We have 2 levels of membership to allow support for mothers of all socio-economic backgrounds to join the movement:1). Online social media platform with 10,000+ members allows all Mamas to join a common community in order to donate and share with one another * provides a safe platform where we can share gently used or new items and services to allow mothers to access items for their kids without the financial barrier  2). Focuses entirely on relieving poverty and all donations made to the organization will be used directly for poverty relief programs * requires Mamas to do an intake at the office to determine how we can best help provide support, can be done by emailing for an intake appointment
